page.title: 19LYNE VILLAGE - THEN AND NOW
page.content: There have been many changes in the village of Lyne during the last fifty years, the most significant being housing development. Where there were once green fields with a few farm cottages there are now houses, and although there is still a small farming community the majority of the inhabitants commute daily to large towns. Another significant change is the disappearance of the village shop and post office which served as a meeting place for the villagers. The village school although destroyed by fire on 5th November l930 was rebuilt and has remained unchanged apart from some modernisation such as central heating replacing open coal fires. The village Church has remained constant throughout all this change and is now the focal point of Lyne village life.
